title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: stating positive externality, and for explaining that either marginal social benefit is greater than marginal private benefit (MSB>MPB) or the equilibrium quantity is less than the socially optimal quantity.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: stating positive externality, and for explaining that either marginal social benefit is greater than marginal private benefit (MSB>MPB) or the equilibrium quantity is less than the socially optimal quantity.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: stating positive externality, and for explaining that either marginal social benefit is greater than marginal private benefit (MSB>MPB) or the equilibrium quantity is less than the socially optimal quantity.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the market equilibrium price as $6 and the market equilibrium quantity as 16 units.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the market equilibrium price as $6 and the market equilibrium quantity as 16 units.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the market equilibrium price as $6 and the market equilibrium quantity as 16 units.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the area of the deadweight loss as DEF.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the area of the deadweight loss as DEF.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying the area of the deadweight loss as DEF.v

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying $4 as the dollar value of the per-unit subsidy.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying $4 as the dollar value of the per-unit subsidy.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying $4 as the dollar value of the per-unit subsidy.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
2 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying 8 units.

1 point(s) earned for: stating no and explaining with one of the following reasons:

  • The quantity exchanged in the market will be less than the socially optimal quantity.

  • MSB>MSC at a quantity of 8 units.

  • Deadweight loss increased after the price floor.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying 8 units.

1 point(s) earned for: stating no and explaining with one of the following reasons:

  • The quantity exchanged in the market will be less than the socially optimal quantity.

  • MSB>MSC at a quantity of 8 units.

  • Deadweight loss increased after the price floor.

The student response earns one of the following points:

2 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying 8 units.

1 point(s) earned for: stating no and explaining with one of the following reasons:

  • The quantity exchanged in the market will be less than the socially optimal quantity.

  • MSB>MSC at a quantity of 8 units.

  • Deadweight loss increased after the price floor.

The student response earns two of the following points:

2 point(s) maximum

1 point(s) earned for: identifying 8 units.

1 point(s) earned for: stating no and explaining with one of the following reasons:

  • The quantity exchanged in the market will be less than the socially optimal quantity.

  • MSB>MSC at a quantity of 8 units.

  • Deadweight loss increased after the price floor.
